page.title: 08LOCAL NEWS
page.content: Items of news taken from the Crewe Chronicle during June 1985. Wistaston County Junior School met wtih the Borough Council in their fight to get flashing warning lights outside the school. As yet they have been unsuccessful. Plans for quarantine kennels at Hough have been turned down after a large petition by local residents complained of the danger of rabies. During a debate Mr.Weston, head of Shavington Junior School, warned about stress on teachers caused by the cutbacks in schools. The programme of extending the availability of a main gas supply is scheduled for Gresty next Spring. Police suspect arson at ATS in Gresty Rd. when a fire broke out one Saturday afternoon damaging the rear of the building and destroying waste tyres.
